responses.body:
[
  {
    "id": "1",
    "title": "To Kill a Mockingbird",
    "author": "Harper Lee",
    "genre": "Fiction",
    "publicationDate": "1960-07-11T00:00:00.000Z",
    "description": "A novel about the serious issues of race, class, gender, and justice in the Deep South, seen through the eyes of young Scout Finch."
  },
  {
    "id": "2",
    "title": "1984",
    "author": "George Orwell",
    "genre": "Dystopian",
    "publicationDate": "1949-06-08T00:00:00.000Z",
    "description": "A chilling depiction of a totalitarian regime, where surveillance and control pervade every aspect of life."
  },
  {
    "id": "3",
    "title": "The Great Gatsby",
    "author": "F. Scott Fitzgerald",
    "genre": "Classic",
    "publicationDate": "1925-04-10T00:00:00.000Z",
    "description": "A story of love, wealth, and betrayal, set in the roaring 1920s and centered on the enigmatic Jay Gatsby."
  },
  {
    "id": "4",
    "title": "Pride and Prejudice",
    "author": "Jane Austen",
    "genre": "Romance",
    "publicationDate": "1813-01-28T00:00:00.000Z",
    "description": "A witty exploration of love, class, and societal expectations through the lives of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy."
  },
  {
    "id": "5",
    "title": "The Hobbit",
    "author": "J.R.R. Tolkien",
    "genre": "Fantasy",
    "publicationDate": "1937-09-21T00:00:00.000Z",
    "description": "The epic tale of Bilbo Baggins, who embarks on a life-changing journey to reclaim treasure guarded by a dragon."
  },
  {
    "id": "6",
    "title": "The Catcher in the Rye",
    "author": "J.D. Salinger",
    "genre": "Fiction",
    "publicationDate": "1951-07-16T00:00:00.000Z",
    "description": "A coming-of-age novel about Holden Caulfield, a teenager navigating alienation and identity in mid-20th century America."
  },
  {
    "id": "7",
    "title": "Moby Dick",
    "author": "Herman Melville",
    "genre": "Adventure",
    "publicationDate": "1851-10-18T00:00:00.000Z",
    "description": "The saga of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to hunt down the white whale, Moby Dick."
  },
  {
    "id": "8",
    "title": "Brave New World",
    "author": "Aldous Huxley",
    "genre": "Science Fiction",
    "publicationDate": "1932-08-01T00:00:00.000Z",
    "description": "A dystopian novel that explores a future society driven by technology, consumerism, and a loss of individuality."
  },
  {
    "id": "9",
    "title": "The Alchemist",
    "author": "Paulo Coelho",
    "genre": "Philosophical",
    "publicationDate": "1988-05-01T00:00:00.000Z",
    "description": "A mystical tale of Santiago, a shepherd who embarks on a journey to discover his personal legend."
  },
  {
    "id": "10",
    "title": "Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone",
    "author": "J.K. Rowling",
    "genre": "Fantasy",
    "publicationDate": "1997-06-26T00:00:00.000Z",
    "description": "The story of Harry Potter, a young wizard who discovers his magical heritage and begins his journey at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry."
  }
]

{
  "id": "11",
  "title": "The Picture of Dorian Gray",
  "author": "Oscar Wilde",
  "genre": "Philosophical",
  "publicationDate": "1890-07-01T00:00:00.000Z",
  "description": "A tale of a young man who becomes increasingly corrupt as he pursues a life of pleasure, while his portrait ages and bears the consequences of his actions."
}
